metadata.Title: CVE-2017-9211 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
The crypto_skcipher_init_tfm function in crypto/skcipher.c in the Linux kernel through 4.11.2 relies on a setkey function that lacks a key-size check, which allows local users to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference) via a crafted application.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9211` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.11.0-1009-azure - 4.11.0-1009.9
linux-image-extra-4.11.0-1009-azure - 4.11.0-1009.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.13.0-1002-gcp - 4.13.0-1002.5
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-1002-gcp - 4.13.0-1002.5
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.13.0-26-generic - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
linux-image-4.13.0-26-generic-lpae - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
linux-image-4.13.0-26-lowlatency - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-26-generic - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.13.0-1008-oem - 4.13.0-1008.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.11.0-1009-azure - 4.11.0-1009.9
linux-image-extra-4.11.0-1009-azure - 4.11.0-1009.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.13.0-1002-gcp - 4.13.0-1002.5
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-1002-gcp - 4.13.0-1002.5
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.13.0-26-generic - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
linux-image-4.13.0-26-generic-lpae - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
linux-image-4.13.0-26-lowlatency - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-26-generic - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2

criterions.comment: linux-azure package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.11.0-1009.9').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'abandoned').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1002.5').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'abandoned').
linux-oem package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1008.9').
linux-signed-azure package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.11.0-1009.9').
linux-signed-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1002.5').
linux-signed-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2').
linux-signed-oem package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1008.9').
